meanings.sent1: The erosive waves slowly broke down the rocks along the shore.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain had an erosive effect on the soil, washing it away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind played an erosive game with the sandcastle, making it crumble.
meanings.sent4: Time can be an erosive force, gradually wearing down even the strongest structures.
meanings.sent5: The erosive power of the river carved magnificent canyons over centuries.

meanings.definition: Tending to erode or wear away
meanings.sent1: The erosive nature of the chemicals made them unsuitable for delicate surfaces.
meanings.sent2: The erosive properties of the abrasive cleaner helped remove tough stains.
meanings.sent3: The erosive tendencies of the puppy's teeth led to many chewed shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: His sharp words had an erosive effect on their friendship, slowly breaking it apart.
meanings.sent5: The erosive quality of time can be seen in the fading of old photographs.
